meanings.definition: Faffed (verb): to waste time or dawdle
meanings.sent1: She faffed around instead of starting her homework.
meanings.sent2: He always faffed when it came to making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The cat faffed with a toy mouse, not catching it.
meanings.sent4: Time faffed away like sand slipping through fingers.
meanings.sent5: Faffed moments turned into lost opportunities.

meanings.sent1: The faffed papers were scattered all over the desk.

meanings.sent3: The faffed directions led them in circles.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a faffed jumble of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The faffed room looked like a tornado had passed through.

meanings.definition: Faffed (adverb): in a disorganized or inefficient manner
meanings.sent1: She worked faffed, causing delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: He drove faffed through the unfamiliar streets.
meanings.sent3: The team moved faffed, bumping into each other.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped faffed through their fingers.
meanings.sent5: The paperwork was handled faffed, leading to mistakes.
